review_data.content: By far my favorite restaurant in Zurich. As I'm French, I always take the same dish: Entrecote cafe de Paris. The meat and the pommes frites allumettes (very thin French fries) are excellent. It's not a cheap restaurant (the entrecote for two costs a bit...More

review_data.title: A delicious meal!
review_data.content: Not cheap, but a real treat! Can't wait to go back again.

review_data.title: A Place of Character
review_data.content: A proper Parisian, if one can close their ears to all the English and German speakers. Excellent, friendly service; good food, properly prepared; backed up by a good, albeit short, wine list. A place, for once, in Zurich, with some atmosphere.

review_data.title: Romantic Location in the old town
review_data.content: Coque au vin and a well assorted list of French wines at realistic prices but also a cosy, romantic alternative to the other eateries in Zurich serving Dieter Meier's argentinian beef. Authentic French Bistrot style atmosphere, not for the either massively overweight or claustrophobic as...More

review_data.title: Great food and service.
review_data.content: Centrally located, great service and some very well-made French classics on the menu. Would certainly go there again.
